title: IMD Predicts Five Days Of Heavy Rain For AP - Deccan Chronicle
article_text:
Tuesday , 22 July 2025
e-Paper
Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process
Home

South
Nation

Home ¬ª Southern States ¬ª¬†Andhra Pradesh
IMD Predicts Five Days Of Heavy Rain For AP
Andhra Pradesh
K.M.P. PATNAIK
22 July 2025 2:49 AM
The report said Guntur, Bapatla, Prakasam, Krishna, NTR, Palnadu, Eluru, Alluri Sitharama Raju, East Godavari, West Godavari, Konaseema, Kakinada, Kurnool, and Nadyal districts will have rain on Tuesday.
During the last 24 hours, rainfall occurred at many places over CAP, Yanam, and most places over Rayalaseema. Heavy rainfall was experienced over Yanam, Bapatla, Srikakulam, NTR, Prakasam, Guntur, Nandyal, and Annamayya districts during the period.‚ÄîDC Image

Visakhapatnam: The IMD on Monday forecast heavy rainfall in parts of Andhra Pradesh for the next five days due to upper air cyclonic circulation over the west-central Bay of Bengal and adjoining areas off south Odisha and north coastal Andhra Pradesh.

The report said Guntur, Bapatla, Prakasam, Krishna, NTR, Palnadu, Eluru, Alluri Sitharama Raju, East Godavari, West Godavari, Konaseema, Kakinada, Kurnool, and Nadyal districts will have rain on Tuesday.

Also Read - Welfare Hostels Shaping Future Of students: Minister

During the last 24 hours, rainfall occurred at many places over CAP, Yanam, and most places over Rayalaseema. Heavy rainfall was experienced over Yanam, Bapatla, Srikakulam, NTR, Prakasam, Guntur, Nandyal, and Annamayya districts during the period.

Four locations‚ÄîAddanki (Bapatla), S Kota (Vizianagaram), Mandasa (Srikakulam), and Vijayawada (NTR district)‚Äîin the state recorded 9 cm of rainfall each between Sunday morning and Monday morning, followed by 8 cm of rainfall each in Chimakurthi (Prakasam), Guntur, and Nandyal; 7 cm of rainfall each in Konakanamitla (Prakasam), Bapatla, Kalakada, and Rajampet in Annamayya district and Rudravaram in Nandyal district; and 6 cm of rainfall each in Ardhaveedu (Prakasam), Kalingapatnam and Ranastalam in Srikakulam district, Nandikotkur and Jupadu in Nandyal district, and Srikalahasti, Sullurpeta, and Thottambedu in Tirupati district.

( Source : Deccan Chronicle )

Flood Alert at Prakasam Barrage Due to Heavy Rains
Pavan Bandari
Hans News Service | 22 July 2025 9:49 AM IST
HIGHLIGHTS
The irrigation authorities have issued a flood alert as heavy rainfall causes water levels to rise at the Prakasam Barrage.

The irrigation authorities have issued a flood alert as heavy rainfall causes water levels to rise at the Prakasam Barrage. The Water Resources Department officials are closely monitoring the situation.

Currently, the barrage is experiencing an inflow of 20,748 cusecs, with 18,125 cusecs being released downstream. Additionally, 2,623 cusecs are diverted to the canals.

The situation is under continuous review to ensure public safety and effective management of water resources. Further updates will be provided as the situation develops.
